title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search

tree.label: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search

children.label: Abstract
children.content: AlphaGo uses value and policy networks trained by supervised and reinforcement learning, achieving 99.8% win rate against other Go programs and defeating the human European champion 5–0.

children.label: Key Figures
children.content: Six figures illustrate the neural-network pipeline, network accuracy, MCTS process, tournament evaluation, and example moves from the Fan Hui match.

children.label: References
children.content: 62 references cover game AI history, Monte-Carlo tree search, deep learning, and prior Go programs.

children.label: Acknowledgements & Author Information
children.content: Thanks to Fan Hui and the DeepMind team; equal contribution by David Silver and Aja Huang; affiliations and contributions listed.

children.label: Extended Data
children.content: Eleven supplementary tables detail match results, network inputs, parameters, and scalability studies.

children.label: Reader Comments
children.content: Three public comments discuss MCTS expansion details, GPU scaling jumps, and the historic AI milestone.

children.label: Editorial Summary
children.content: Nature’s summary highlights AlphaGo as the first program to defeat a human professional on a full 19×19 board without handicap.
